comment._content: He was the son of James Keir Hardie, Sr. (15 August 1856 - 26 September 1915) James Keir Hardie, Sr. was a Scottish socialist and labour leader, and was the first Independent Labour Member of Parliament (MPs) elected to the UK Parliament, seven years before the founding conference of the Labour Party. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keir_Hardie

comment._content: According to NYT, August 27, 1912 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A0CEEDA1630E233A... Keir Hardie Jr. was to be married on August 29, 1912, in Brooklyn to his childhood sweetheart from Scotland who had traveled to the States with her future father-in law. She was Marion (or Marian) Dalrymple Stoddart (or Stoddard) -- I found variant spellings in the NYT. Keir Hardie Jr. had been in business in Brooklyn for several years." So this is presumably after August 1912.
